alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 07 at 12:45PM PST until November 09 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, except 1 to 4 feet along the Sierra Crest above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph along Highway 395 and gusts near and above 100 mph over Sierra ridgelines through Tuesday evening. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact commute times over mountain passes. Strong winds may damage trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for whiteout conditions and subzero wind chills along the foothills and ridgelines of the Sierra.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
